intro: Ardisia ravida, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds and other wildlife. Ardisia ravida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
